content: even with each other before proceeding to the next step close any gaps left where you switched colors by weaving in the ends for a few stitches using a tapestry needle don t worry about weaving in the ends fully as they ll be hidden after the next step 9 making sure you keep the stitches aligned between needles *k2tog twice p2tog twice* one from the front needle and one from the back needle you should end up with 72 84 stitches total all on one needle 10 k all sts 1 round cut cc 11 continue to body section of pattern for fold up brim version 1 using long tail cast on cast on 72 84 sts using cc join in the round making sure not to twist your stitches pm for bor 2 *k2 p2* in cc until work measures 3/4 of an inch from cast on edge approx 4 rounds 3 *k2 p2* 3 rounds in mc you can either cut the colors in between the stripes and weave in the ends or carry the other color up on the front of your work so it is ​ ​ hidden when the brim is folded up 4 *k2 p2* 2 rounds in cc 5 *k2 p2* 3 rounds in mc cut mc 6 *k2 p2* in cc until work measures 7 inches from cast on edge approx 24 rounds 2 7 k all sts 1 round cut cc 8 continue to body section of pattern body same for both brim versions 1 join mc k all sts until the work measures 4 inches from where mc was joined approx 24 rounds feel free to add or subtract rounds to make the hat fit as you like 2 set up for decreases k6 7 *pm k12 14 *x5 k6 7 you should have 6 equidistant markers denoting where the decreases will go and one marker denoting the bor which will be halfway between two of the decrease markers 3 *k to 2 before marker ssk slip marker k2tog* k to end of round decrease 12 sts each round 4 k all sts 1 round 5 repeat rounds 3 and 4 4 5 more times 12 sts left on the needles switch to dpns or magic loop as needed 6 *k2tog* 6 sts remaining 7 cut yarn use a tapestry needle to pick up remaining stitches and feed yarn tail through pull tight and weave in the tail finishing weave in any exposed ends add a pompom if desired notes sizing if you d like to size the pattern up or down you can add or remove multiples of 12 stitches for example - you can cast on 60 stitches for an older child size hat likewise if you want to use a different weight of yarn you can size up or down keep in mind that reducing/adding the multiples of 12 will either increase or decrease the number of row in the crown
